title: Google Chrome to block admin-level browser launches for better security
summary: Google is rolling out a change to Chromium that "de-elevates" Google Chrome so it does not run as an administrator to increase security in Windows. [...]

title: Hackers behind UK retail attacks now targeting US companies
summary: Google warned today that hackers using Scattered Spider tactics against retail chains in the United Kingdom have also started targeting retailers in the United States. [...]

title: Samsung Patches CVE-2025-4632 Used to Deploy Mirai Botnet via MagicINFO 9 Exploit
summary:
Samsung has released software updates to address a critical security flaw in MagicINFO 9 Server that has been actively exploited in the wild.
The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-4632 (CVSS score: 9.8), has been described as a path traversal flaw.

title: BianLian and RansomExx Exploit SAP NetWeaver Flaw to Deploy PipeMagic Trojan
summary:
At least two different cybercrime groups BianLian and RansomExx are said to have exploited a recently disclosed security flaw in SAP NetWeaver, indicating that multiple threat actors are taking advantage of the bug.

title: Ransomware gangs join ongoing SAP NetWeaver attacks
summary: Ransomware gangs have joined ongoing SAP NetWeaver attacks, exploiting a maximum-severity vulnerability that allows threat actors to gain remote code execution on vulnerable servers. [...]

title: Australian Human Rights Commission leaks docs to search engines
summary: The Australian Human Rights Commission (AHRC) disclosed a data breach incident where private documents leaked online and were indexed by major search engines. [...]

title: Xinbi Telegram Market Tied to $8.4B in Crypto Crime, Romance Scams, North Korea Laundering
summary:
A Chinese-language, Telegram-based marketplace called Xinbi Guarantee has facilitated no less than $8.4 billion in transactions since 2022, making it the second major black market to be exposed after HuiOne Guarantee.

title: Microsoft fixes Linux boot issues on dual-boot Windows systems
summary: ​Microsoft has fixed a known issue preventing Linux from booting on dual-boot systems with Secure Boot enabled after installing the August 2024 Windows security updates. [...]

title: Steel giant Nucor Corporation facing disruptions after cyberattack
summary: A cybersecurity incident on Nucor Corporation's systems forced the company to take offline parts of its networks and implement containment measures. [...]

title: CTM360 Identifies Surge in Phishing Attacks Targeting Meta Business Users
summary:
A new global phishing threat called "Meta Mirage" has been uncovered, targeting businesses using Meta's Business Suite. This campaign specifically aims at hijacking high-value accounts, including those managing advertising and official brand pages.

title: Focused Phishing: Attack Targets Victims With Trusted Sites and Live Validation
summary: New phishing tactics are abusing trusted domains, real CAPTCHAs, and server-side email validation to selectively target victims with customized fake login pages. Keep Aware's latest research breaks down the full attack chain and how these zero-day phish operate. [...]

title: Fashion giant Dior discloses cyberattack, warns of data breach
summary: House of Dior, the French luxury fashion brand commonly referred to as Dior, has disclosed a cybersecurity incident that has exposed customer information. [...]

title: Kosovo extradites BlackDB admin to face US cybercrime charges
summary: A Kosovo national has been extradited to the United States to face charges of running an online cybercrime marketplace active since 2018. [...]

title: Patch Tuesday, May 2025 Edition
summary: Microsoft on Tuesday released software updates to fix at least 70 vulnerabilities in Windows and related products, including five zero-day flaws that are already seeing active exploitation.
